summary: Email exchange between attorney Bruce Barket and an MCC official regarding an investigation into potential retaliation against inmate Nicholas Tartaglione, and a forwarded inquiry from a journalist about Tartaglione being questioned regarding a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at MCC.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing inmate Nicholas Tartaglione, corresponding with MCC officials about an investigation and potential leaks to the press.

persons.name: Nick
persons.context: Referred to as Bruce Barket's client, an inmate at MCC who was reportedly questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Tracy Connor
persons.context: Journalist from The Daily Beast who emailed Bruce Barket seeking confirmation of an NBC story about his client being questioned regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of a possible attack at MCC, which prompted a journalist's inquiry about Barket's client being questioned.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Full name of 'Nick', Bruce Barket's client at MCC who was the subject of an internal investigation and press inquiries.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is the legal representative for inmate Nicholas Tartaglione, advocating on his behalf regarding prison conditions and media leaks.
Both were inmates at MCC; Tartaglione was reportedly questioned about a possible attack on Epstein.
Connor, a journalist, contacted Barket seeking confirmation of a news story about his client and Epstein.

events.title: Journalist Inquiry About Epstein Attack
events.description: Tracy Connor from The Daily Beast emails Bruce Barket seeking confirmation of an NBC story that his client, Nicholas Tartaglione, was questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at MCC.

events.title: MCC Official Responds on Investigation
events.description: An MCC official (name redacted) responds to Bruce Barket, stating the matter is under an open investigation and that staff have been reminded not to retaliate against his client.

events.title: Barket Thanks MCC Official
events.description: Bruce Barket thanks an MCC official for personally checking on his client Nick and swapping out his books, acknowledging good work done.

locations: 666 Old Country Road, Ste. 700, Garden City, NY 11530
keyFacts: An internal investigation was ongoing at MCC regarding potential retaliation against inmate Nicholas Tartaglione, client of attorney Bruce Barket.
A journalist from The Daily Beast contacted Barket to confirm an NBC story that Tartaglione was questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at MCC.
MCC officials stated they had reminded staff not to retaliate against Tartaglione and that no information had been shared with the press about the open investigation.
The email chain shows attorney Bruce Barket actively monitoring his client's treatment in custody and engaging with both prison officials and the media.
